transportAdvice: Cologne has an extensive public transit network including metro (U-Bahn), trams, and buses that connect all major tourist areas efficiently; day and multi-day transit passes offer good value for visitors. The city center around the cathedral and old town is very walkable, and taxis are readily available throughout the city.

weather.description: Cold and grey with frequent overcast skies; pack warm layers and a waterproof jacket.
Still cold and wintry but days begin to lengthen slightly; Carnival festivities can make the city lively despite the chill.
Early spring brings milder temperatures and occasional sunny spells, though showers remain common.
Pleasant spring weather with blooming parks; a mix of sunny days and light rain showers.
Warm and increasingly sunny; one of the more enjoyable months to explore the city on foot.
Warm summer conditions with long daylight hours; occasional thunderstorms are possible.
The warmest month of the year with plenty of sunshine; outdoor terraces and Rhine promenades are busy.
Warm and summery with similar conditions to July; brief afternoon thunderstorms can occur.
Early autumn brings comfortable temperatures and a gradual shift toward cooler, crisper air.
Noticeably cooler with more frequent rain; autumn foliage adds colour to parks and riverside walks.
Grey and damp with cold temperatures; the famous Christmas markets begin to open late in the month.
Cold and festive with renowned Christmas markets along the Rhine; occasional frost or light snow is possible.
